channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Water running down Collum End Rise, 3rd January
item.description:
Water has been running for the road for months now. As the colder weather approaches there is thick ice, after only a light frost. This is going to be very dangerous as snow if forecast .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Collum End Rise, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Outside nos 45 & 47 Snowshill Drive, 3rd January
item.description:
Outside these two properties is a designated turning circle. We have repeatedly asked the residents not to park in & block this area but they continue to do so. Recently an ambulance had difficulty in manouvering at the top of the cul de sac, and the bin lorries/delivery vehicles have the same issue. We at nos 26, 28 & 30 are unable to turn our vehicles to reverse onto/off our driveways. Could we please have some double yellow lines painted to prevent this unsociable parking?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Snowshill Drive, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple gully drains blocked with debris, 3rd January
item.description:
From the eastern end of stoke road going west
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Stoke Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath off gotherington lane leading to playing fields, 3rd January
item.description:
Two sections have never received a top layer of tarmaccadam since street lighting was repositioned. A serious concern of trip hazard. Reported twice before to TBC and BCPC. Also the footpath adjacent to Sanderling Way has the same issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43, Gotherington Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Crossing audible sound too loud/soft problem, 3rd January
item.description:
Customer reporting controlled crossing behind the college is not working at all. No further details of location and customer did not leave any details.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large branch fallen into pavement, 3rd January
item.description:
Outside 45 Mendip Road on grass verge. This was a hanging branch that was previously reported and deemed safe! Luckily no one was injured or property damaged when it broke and fell.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Mendip Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 3rd January
item.description:
Customer has called and they say they have a cover on the boundary of their property. This is depositing water onto the footway from the drive, someone has slipped on this today and they have shouted at the homeowner. They say they have had STW out a couple of times and they say this nothing to do with their assets, it is likely a high water table resulting from the grass area to the east of the property and the water may be building on the retaining wall, as this is not an issue in the summer. Customer is going to send some images in to look at location and wonders if the AHR can assist with this.
Report on FixMyStreet
